column4: just wondering if you guys have a firewall. I'm thinking of getting firestarter (www.fs-security.com). Is this kind of security necessary for Ubuntu users?
linuxjones, what features do you like?
what features are good to have? I hear Linux is safe. So what would be the point of a firewall?
is there a list of differences b/w the new version of ubuntuguide and the previous?
question: get firestarter from the website or from repositories?
repositories is usually better
repositories will always have the same version as the websites?
not at all...
but that's not necessarily a bad thing, either
what are the advantages of getting stuff from repositories as opposed to the websites?
thank you. thank you for your responses. Wow, the love!
And the encouragement to stay with the repositories...
why then can we not have the repositories always have the most current stuff in them, as like in the websites?
what's iirc?
frozes?
frozen?
need to keep a satble system...
s/satble/stable
by "those other repositories" you mean the universe and multiverse?
the release version gets frozen, then work begins on the next release... and stuff breaks early and often there...
or are multivers and universe jus t as safe?
universe and multiverse are official repositories... quite safe
